CONTROLLER_STOP_ADDRESS_RELATIVE
[CONTROLLER]


Classes

class  INSTLIB::CONTROL_STOP_ADDRESS_RELATIVE

INT32 INSTLIB::CONTROL_STOP_ADDRESS_RELATIVE::CheckKnobs (CONTROL_HANDLER ch, VOID *val)
VOID INSTLIB::CONTROL_STOP_ADDRESS_RELATIVE::Event (CONTROL_EVENT ev)

Detailed Description

Controller for detecting the end of an interval using an address or symbol and a count *relative to the last START event* Use -stop_address_relative [address|address:count|symbol|symbol:count|address:count]

Function Documentation

INT32 INSTLIB::CONTROL_STOP_ADDRESS_RELATIVE::CheckKnobs ( CONTROL_HANDLER  ch,
VOID *  val 
) [inline, inherited]

Activate the controller if the -stop_address knob is provided

Returns:
1 if controller can start an interval, otherwise 0

VOID INSTLIB::CONTROL_STOP_ADDRESS_RELATIVE::Event ( CONTROL_EVENT  ev  )  [inline, inherited]

Notify the controller about an event. If the event is a START, this controller sets the address count alarm making the counting relative to the START event.
